page.description: Report on the contents of a zip file.
page.prototype: File_List as C = FILE.ZipList(C zipfilename[,C Separator])

argument.name: zipfilename
argument.description: The name of the zip file to open.

description.p: Information about how to format the output. You can use the following codes in the Format_String.
All other characters in the Format_String will print as is. For example, to create a comma separated list of files in the zip file, you would use this format string: *[xb:"n" + ","]*
To create list of filenames in the zip file with each name on its own line, you would use this format string: *[xb:"n" + chr(13) + chr(10)]*

return.name: File_List
return.description: Returns the list of files in the zip file.

page.discussion: The FILE.ZIPLIST() method returns a character string with all of the files in Zip_Filename, formatted according to the Format_String.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script lists all of the files in a zip file to the Trace window.

section.note: FILE.ZIPLIST does not support creating password protected zip archives.
